intro: Caraipa andina, commonly known as the Andean caraipa, is a flowering plant native to the high Andes of South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants like buckwheat and sorrel. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit and clusters of small, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in late summer. Its leaves are typically broad and oval, with a rough texture. Caraipa andina is adapted to high-altitude environments and is often found in rocky or alpine regions.
